titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the New-York Historical Society Bequests, Gifts & Related Matters Record Group
1852-1992
NYHS-RG 16
titlestmt.author: Larry Weimer

sponsor.emph: This record group was processed as part of the 2015-2016 N-YHS Institutional Archives project, made possible by a generous grant from the Leon Levy Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 15:49:43 -0400.

did.unittitle: New-York Historical Society bequests, gifts and related matters

physdesc.extent: in 20 document boxes and 1 record carton

did.abstract: The New-York Historical Society bequests, gifts & related matters record group (NYHS-RG 16) primarily includes records concerning estates in which N-YHS was named as a beneficiary. Most of these instances resulted in N-YHS receiving museum objects, manuscripts, books, or other items or a financial legacy. The record group also includes files of some donations of objects and funds from donors during their lifetimes, as well as some purchases. The record group includes files on some of the most important patrons and objects in N-YHS's history.
did.physloc: Materials in this collection may be stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.
did.langmaterial: The documents in the collection are in English.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: The record group is organized in four series, three of which are restricted.
Series II. Bequests from Circa 1960-1982 (1927-1984) RESTRICTED UNTIL 2033
Series III. Bequests from Circa 1983-1988 (1953-1990) RESTRICTED UNTIL 2039
Series IV. Bequests from Circa 1989-1992 (1964-1992) RESTRICTED UNTIL 2043

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Series I is open to qualified researchers. N-YHS generally restricts the records of the Board and the Executive Office, and certain other related records, for fifty years following the conclusion of the tenure of a President and CEO (formerly, Director). Accordingly, Series II, III, and IV are restricted until 2033, 2039, and 2043, respectively.
Materials in this collection may be stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Taking images of documents from the library collections for reference purposes by using hand-held cameras and in accordance with the library's photography guidelines is encouraged. As an alternative, patrons may request up to 20 images per day from staff.

Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to: Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 282.

Copyrights and other proprietary rights may subsist in individuals and entities other than the New-York Historical Society, in which case the patron is responsible for securing permission from those parties. For fuller information about rights and reproductions from N-YHS visit: https://www.nyhistory.org/about/rights-reproductions

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation Note
prefercite.p: This record group should be cited as New-York Historical Society bequests, gifts & related matters (NYHS-RG 16), The New-York Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information Note
processinfo.p: Most of the original files were processed over time, perhaps circa 1980-2000, with documents transferred from original folders to archival containers. In 2016, project archivist Larry Weimer integrated additional unprocessed material and created a detailed inventory, but the record group remained restricted at that time. In late 2017, Weimer and volunteer Alison Barr rearranged the content to facilitate opening Series I, which includes most of the files, to patrons.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials Note
relatedmaterial.p: This finding aid relates to just one record group of the New-York Historical Society archives. For information about the other record groups and for overall information about the archives, please see the Guide to the New-York Historical Society Archives (NYHS-RG Archives).

Though this bequests, gifts & related matters record group (NYHS-RG 16) includes extensive and substantive content, there are several other record groups that include files concerning N-YHS acquisitions. These are as follows:
The Collection Accession Registers (NYHS-RG 15) include lists of donations and purchases from the 1840s to 1962, though they can be inconsistent in their coverage and detail.
The New-York Historical Society management committee records (NYHS-RG 1) includes minutes and so-called "official papers," both of which include reference to acquisitions.
General Correspondence (NYHS-RG 2) includes acquisitions, among many other topics.
The Museum Department Records (NYHS-RG 20) and Library Department Records (NYHS-RG 21) include acquisition records, principally for the twentieth century.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: The New-York Historical Society bequests, gifts & related matters record group (NYHS-RG 16) primarily includes records concerning estates in which N-YHS was named as a beneficiary. Most of these instances resulted in N-YHS receiving museum objects, manuscripts, books, or other items or a financial legacy. In some instances, N-YHS was named as a residuary legatee or specified conditions needed to be met to receive the bequest. In yet other instances, N-YHS renounced the bequest.

In addition to bequests, the series also includes records of some donations of objects and funds from donors during their lifetimes, as well as of items placed on deposit with N-YHS. Some purchases are also documented in the series. The files most commonly hold correspondence, wills and codicils or abstracts of same, Surrogate Court notices and filings, and receipts. Many files also hold inventories, appraisals, agreements related to purchases, deposits or other transactions, and other documents.

The record group includes files on some of the major patrons and objects in N-YHS's history, including the Beekmans, Belknaps, Thomas J. Bryan, Crawford's sculpture The Indian, the Gallatin family, Cass Gilbert drawings, the Livingstons, Katharine Prentis Murphy, James Lenox's Nineveh sculptures, Katherine R. Rogers, the Thompson family, and many others. The container list includes a detailed inventory of the files.

controlaccess.subject: Acquisitions (Libraries) -- New York (State) -- New York.
Courts -- New York (State) -- New York.
Lawyers -- New York (State) -- New York.
Libraries -- Gifts, legacies.
Museums -- Acquisitions -- New York (State) -- New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: This series includes records of bequests and other gifts from 1852 to about 1960. Given that every file in the series represents a completely different matter and that the files span about 100 years of donations, the subject content of each file is noted in the container list. Many of the files include rich documentation including that for many acquisitions important in N-YHS's history, among them gifts and/or bequests from Thomas J. Bryan, Gerard Beekman (family coach), Waldron Phoenix Belknap, Jr. and his mother, Rey Hutchings Belknap, the Gallatin family, John Divine Jones, the Robert Livingston family, Pirie MacDonald, and Katharine Prentis Murphy and her brother, Edmund Astley Prentis. The series includes extensive documentation of the large financial legacy received from the Thompson family estate that was used to expand the Central Park West building and N-YHS's programs and staff in 1937-38. Among the major accessions documented in the series are Thomas Crawford's sculpture The Indian (from Frederic de Peyster), the drawings of architect Cass Gilbert, ancient Nineveh sculptures (from James Lenox), and bronze models by sculptor John Rogers (from his daughter, Katherine). The series includes some purchases, such as the Robert Bracklow photographs from Alexander Alland, portrait paintings from artist DeWitt Lockman, the Nadelman folk art collection, and Leonidas Westervelt's Jenny Lind collection.

In addition to acquisitions from individuals, the series also holds files on some institutions that donated or deposited their records to N-YHS, or considered the possibility. Among these is the 1938 proposal, eventually declined, of the donation of the collections of the Marine Museum of the City of New York to N-YHS. Other institutions include, among others, the Naval History Society; the Military Order of the Loyal Legion of the U.S., Commandery of the State of New York; the Protestant Episcopal Church in the United States; and the Sons of Rhode Island in New York.

Some files include subjects tangentially related to the bequest or gift itself. These include the exhibition of the Belknap Collection in 1950; the installations of the Prentis-Murphy Collection (1950s) and the Nadelman Folk Art Collection (circa 1940); the 1912 New York State court case concluding that N-YHS was an educational institution for the purpose of exemption from a transfer tax on bequests (De Peyster, C. Augusta file); the financial records for production of the first volume paid from the John Divine Jones Fund; and the successful effort to overturn the directive in the will of Augustus Van Horne Stuyvesant, Jr. to destroy much of his property. Generally the cut-off for this series is 1960, but there are later documents in the series that are included as they relate to the earlier transaction.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: The series is arranged in alphabetical order by name. The names were generally taken from the original folders, and typically are the name of an estate, donor, lender, seller, or other source of an object or funds. Some names, though, refer to the item received.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Appears to be a list of pending wills and estates in which N-YHS was named as a legatee, as of circa 1935 with annotated updates to circa 1941.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of Abeel and Duyckinck family portraits and funds for their care. File includes photographs of the portraits (accessions 1918.1, 1918.2, 1918.6, 1918.8, 1918.9, 1918.19).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Principally includes documents related to George T. and William G. Mortimer (obituaries, photographs, extract from George's will, and George's honorable discharge from the 71st Regiment of New York (1901). Also includes the printed "Memoir of Cyrus Cornelius Adams."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Surrogate Court notices only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of pitchers, glass, and other museum objects, and woodcuts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of a portrait of Aymar's grandfather of the same name. An unrelated reference to the Thompson estate matter is included in one of the letters in the file.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of Theodorus Bailey's N-YHS membership to his daughter, Rosalie. Loan (L.1953.2) of portrait of Nathaniel Platt Bailey and return (1973).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of tea set.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of various genealogical papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of books, pamphlets, and pie crust table formerly owned by Philip Schuyler. The file includes 1918 correspondence and invoice concerning the table's provenance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Includes a copy of the certificate of incorporation of the Beekman Family Association and deeds of gifts to it from Gerard Beekman, and related documents (1909-1910, 1913); gift of Beekman to N-YHS of the family coach, room linings and parts of the entrance from the Turtle Bay house (1911), with funds for the care of the objects; notice of probated will (1919); lists of Beekman family objects at N-YHS (1946) and related documents.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Includes gifts, bequests, and loans from Waldron Phoenix Belknap, Jr. (died 1949) and his mother, Rey Hutchings Belknap (died 1960), and other correspondence related to particular objects. Includes correspondence and other matter related to the 1950 exhibition of the collection. Includes the loan receipts and other documents, both from Mrs. Belknap and various institutions, for the 1955 exhibition of colonial portraits derived from English mezzotint engravings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Gift of silver dinner service formerly owned by Commodore Matthew C. Perry.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Gift and bequest of Bryan's art collection. The folders include an 1852-53 scrapbook of clippings about the collection, the original indenture by which the collection was donated to N-YHS, with inventory attached; drafts of the agreement; a statement from Bryan's heirs (circa 1870) relinquishing claims; and the printed proceedings announcing Bryan's death (1870).

Includes various title abstracts and other documents related to real estate ownership at 849 East 169th Street in Morrisania (1905-06).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Underwriting of a microfilming project. Underwriting of a cooperative effort to collect photostat images of broadsides (The Bailey Gitelson Library of Americana). File includes copies of various issues of "The Chronicle" and "The Magnet," publications of the Gitelson-Kamaiko Foundation. Other topics are also included in the files, including an attempt by Gitelson's daughter, Susan Aurelia Gitelson, with N-YHS's support, to establish an essay contest at Barnard College and Gitelson's attempt (declined) to publish an article in N-YHS's Quarterly.

scopecontent.p: Gift of a vase presented to Lafayette Post No. 140 by Bartholdi in 1887 (1923). Loan (1930) and return (1968) of a chair purportedly used by Lafayette during the Revolutionary War. Gift of a flag presented to Camp No. 140 by William Tecumseh Sherman in 1889 (1931).

scopecontent.p: Inventory of items from McWhorter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Donation of Commandery's library of Civil War books, including an original impression of the terms of surrender at Appomattox, and photographs (1926).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Financial legacy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of theater programs and autographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of letters of Washington, Hancock, Zachary Taylor, and others, and several paintings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of silver and other objects.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of statues, statuettes, medallions, etc. (1924). Deposit by (1924, 1935), and return to (1943), Mrs. I. Sheldon Tilney manuscripts, maps, books, and other matter known as the Charles Allen Munn Collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of two paintings by George Frederick Munn.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Purchase from Mrs. George Murdock, Jr. of her late father-in-law's collection of notes and other documentation related to steamboats.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Gift of four oil portraits and a silver cup (including accession numbers 1951.1 to 1951.4). Financial gift. Includes correspondence related to the acquisition of the Prentis Murphy collection and preparations of the period rooms for their display. See also folders below for Prentis, Edmund Astley and for Prentis-Murphy Collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Purchase of Elie Nadelman's collection. Includes some correspondence concerning the preparations for the display of the collection at N-YHS.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Purchase by Samuel V. Hoffman for N-YHS from George W. Nash of Nash's collection of household objects and church models from Hurley, New York.

did.unittitle: Naval and Military Order of the Spanish-American War

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Permanent deposit of the Order's records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Includes documents related to Franklin D. Roosevelt's proposed amalgamation of the Ship Model Society, Marine Society, and Naval History Society with N-YHS (1924); includes a document that is likely Roosevelt's proposal, Alexander J. Wall's notes of a Ship Model Society meeting at which the proposal was discussed, and a report of a visit to Roosevelt by N-YHS representatives. Also includes documents related to the donation of the Naval History Society's collection and to N-YHS and the establishment of the Naval History Fund (1925-26). Documents from 1977 relate to the publishing of select materials from the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Deposition concerning provenance and owership of a butler bowl.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of a needlepoint sampler marked "Emily Almire Chappell 1830."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Long term loan from the Institute's library of a portrait of Thomas Addis Emmit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Donation by James Lenox of 13 Assyrian marble reliefs he purchased for N-YHS from Henry Stevens. Includes correspondence related to the shipment of the reliefs to N-YHS from Boston and other locations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of three portraits of Mr. and Mrs. Wynant Van Zandt.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Notes about Henry Ogden and the collection of drawings, manuscript notes, lantern slides, and other items received from Ogden's estate.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Gift of 82 paperweights. Financial legacy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Purchase by Philip M. Plant of the Pach Brothers's photographs displayed in their exhibition "American Personalities Through Seven Decades" and donated through Pach to N-YHS (1938). Loan of photographs by N-YHS to Pach for exhibition with indication that additional photographs would be donated by Pach to the collection (1946).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Financial legacy. Purchase from estate of a set of Stokes Iconography of Manhattan Island. Gift from Paltsis's children of various papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of books, pamphlets, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of three portrait paintings of the Maverick family.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of two Livingston portraits and a financial legacy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Financial gift to establish the "Howland Gallatin Pell Binding Fund."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of a coffee cup formerly owned by President Monroe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of books and manuscripts and a financial legacy. The folder includes a printed copy of Phoenix's will, memorials, and photocopies of accession cards recording Phoenix's donations and bequest.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Gift of manuscripts and other items concerning Captain James Lawrence (1942). One item, considered to be a loan, returned to Pool's son (1949).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Deposit by Edward Everett Post of correspondence, drawings and material related to the practice of his grandfather, George B. Post, and the firm of Geo. B. Post & Sons.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning the Knapp family collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Gift, with Katherine Prentis Murphy, of colonial furniture and its installation in rooms at N-YHS. Gifts of paintings, court cupboard, spoons, and other objects. Financial contributions. Conveyance of gift from Mrs. Blake Donaldson of an 1864 publication. Includes a roughly drawn organization chart of N-YHS done by director Vail for Prentis at his request as a new trustee. See also folders above for Murphy, Katharine Prentis and below for Prentis-Murphy Collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Inventories of gifts and loans and summaries of expenses related to the collection (1950-53). Correspondence concerning acquisition (1949-50). Magazine articles. Correspondence concerning the collection (1951-53). Copies of the final wills of Katharine Prentis Murphy and Edmund Astley Prentis (1964-67). Some correspondence concerning the decision to dismantle the Prentis exhibition rooms, thereby relinquishing the collection to Columbia University (1981-82). See also folders above for Prentis, Edmund Astley and for Prentis-Murphy Collection.

did.unittitle: Protestant Episcopal Church in the United States

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Deposit (1929) and return (1962) of the church archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Deposit of Randel's 19th century maps and field books by Joseph O.B. Webster (1913) and correspondence concerning a possible claim on them (1964). Includes insurance policies (1871) and notice of sale (1875) for the maps.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of two lithographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Purchase receipt for watercolor A Surround by A.J Miller.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Gift from Roach's heirs of silver service set presented to Roach by the Merchants of New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of a Clement C. Moore desk and a map of the Lansing farm.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of a miniature and a daguerreotype related to the Delancey family.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Purchase of 35 bronze models of groups sculpted by John Rogers (1936). Gift of a bust of Rogers's son and various letters and other papers (1951). Loan from Mrs. Alexander Parker Rogers of a statuette of Judge Henry E. Howland (1952). Gifts and loans of portraits (1955, 1961). Return of loans (1968, 1973).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Notice of probate only

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Loan (1923) and return (1934) of weather cock. Loan of weather cock and other objects (1939). Photocopy of accession card indicating return of cock in 1967.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Financial legacy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Surrogate Court notice only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of a corner cabinet, music stand, candelabra, a medal from the St. Nicholas Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Financial legacy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest from Harriet L. Schuyler of family portraits bequeathed to N-YHS via Harriet from Philip Schuyler (1915). Financial contributions and bequest of additional portraits from the Schuyler sisters Louisa Lee and Georgina (1916-25), with the involvement of Mary Schuyler Hamilton. Gift of miniature watercolor portrait of Pierre Toussaint, signed Menucci, two others of Toussaint's family members, and one of Madame Jean Berard de Pithou, and other items/documents from Georgina (1920). Gift from Louisa Lee of Sheffield plated ware and glass belonging to General Philip Schuyler (1922). (Georgina died in 1923, Louisa Lee died in 1926.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of silver tea service and other silver objects formerly belonging to Lord Stirling and to Clarkson Crolius.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Gift from the 107th Infantry, New York National Guard, of library, including manuscripts, books and bookcases, portraits, photographs, weapons, and other objects.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Financial legacy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Unidentified bequest.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Revoked bequest of scrapbooks.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Gift from Harold A. Shircliffe of his father's collection of more than 10,000 menus, with filing cabinets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of Smith and Farrington genealogies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of manuscripts, photographs, and other material, and financial legacy for purpose of publishing Smith's writings. Includes biographical and other research and production notes related to the preparation at N-YHS of the resulting publication Springs and Wells of Manhattan and the Bronx. Includes correspondence related to the distribution of the publication to Smith family members and others.

did.unittitle: Sons of Rhode Island in New York

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Deposit from the organization upon its dissolution of its records, banner, and other items. Creation of the Fund of the Sons of Rhode Island in New York for purchasing materials concerning Rhode Island history.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of silver tray with engraving of the Red Brick Presbyterian Church of New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of the family's Dutch Bible.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of engravings, prints, and books, including those from the library of her late husband, Byam K. Stevens.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Financial beneficiary through Lauretta S. Miller Trust.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of maps, engravings, photographs, and other items (1945). Gift from estate of a scrapbook concerning the 1908-09 preservation of Trinity Church's St. Paul's Chapel (1945). Gift from estate of painting The Sowing of the Seed by Huntington (1948); includes provenance documentation between Stokes and Huntington (1868, 1873).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Bequest of family tree, a miniature, and a painting (1953). Gift from St. Luke's Hospital of papers, maps, and account book from the estate that were bequeathed to it (1954). Includes correspondence related to objections raised in court by the executors, with N-YHS's urging, over Stuyvesant's will directing the destruction of certain portraits and other objects; items held on deposit at N-YHS during court process. Gift of objects to N-YHS from the estate following the court decision to not follow will's direction (1956-57).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Financial gift.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: This folder and the next several labeled "Thompson Family" concern the estates of the siblings Charles, Elizabeth, and Mary Thompson, which eventually resulted in N-YHS, as residuary legatee, receiving a financial bequest.
